SEARCH
Package game.animation

Class WalkerAnimationFrames

java.lang.Object
game.animation.WalkerAnimationFrames
public final class WalkerAnimationFrames extends Object
The WalkerAnimationFrames class extends the abstract class AnimationFrames to manage animation frames for different types of walkers. It initialises the frames based on the walker type and animation state.
Since:
05-02-2025
Author:
Alexander Smolowitz, alexander.smolowitz@city.ac.uk

  • Field Details

    • parentFolder

      protected String parentFolder
      The parent folder where the animation frames are stored. This is typically the name of the character or object.

    • folder

      protected String folder
      The specific folder within the parent folder where the animation frames are stored. This is typically the name of the animation

    • numFrames

      protected int numFrames
      The number of frames in the animation. The number of images in the specified folder.

    • height

      protected float height
      Used to create the BodyImage objects.

    • Y_OFFSET

      protected float Y_OFFSET
      The Y offset for the animation frames. Used in the creation of an AttachedImage.

    • X_OFFSET

      protected float X_OFFSET
      The X offset for the animation frames. Used in the creation of an AttachedImage.

  • Constructor Details

    • WalkerAnimationFrames

      public WalkerAnimationFrames(State animationName, WalkerType walkerType)
      Constructor for WalkerAnimationFrames. Initializes the animation frames for the specified walker type and animation state.
      Parameters:
      animationName - The state of the animation (e.g. IDLE, RUN).
      walkerType - The type of walker (e.g. PLAYER, WIZARD).

  • Method Details

    • loadFrames

      protected void loadFrames()
      Loads animation frames from the specified folder. Ensures no duplicate frames are loaded if called multiple times.

    • getAnimationFrames

      protected ArrayList<GameBodyImage> getAnimationFrames()
      Returns the list of loaded animation frames.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of BodyImage objects representing the animation frames.
